Context:
Program Name: Dental Hygiene
Code: S134
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters)
Starting Months: September
Domestic Tuition: $17,265.00 *
International Tuition: $35,269.00 **
Location: Waterfront Campus
Program Description: The Dental Hygiene program prepares students to practice as primary oral health-care providers. It focuses on developing interpersonal communication skills and professionalism while applying the dental hygiene process of care. Students have the opportunity to gain confidence in their learned skills while working with clients in the WAVE Dental Clinic.

* Domestic tuition is for Canadian students.
** International tuition is for students from other countries.

Program Availability:
- Fall 2023: Closed for new applications
- Winter 2024: Not Available for new applications
- Spring 2024: Not Available for new applications

Related Programs: Dental Assisting (Levels I and II) (S113), Restorative Dental Hygiene (Postgraduate) (S400), Honours Bachelor of Science (Dental Hygiene) (S305)
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Dental Hygiene Program S134 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: The Dental Hygiene program at the college is accredited by the Commission on Dental Accreditation of Canada. Graduates of this program are eligible to apply for the National Dental Hygiene Certification Examination and, upon successful completion, can register with the College of Dental Hygienists of Ontario (CDHO) to practice in the province. The program is a six-semester course with field experience starting from semester 1. In semesters 1 and 2, students practice on manikins. From semesters 3 to 6, they progressively treat real clients both at the college's on-site WAVE Dental Clinic and off-site with various community partners. The clinic has over 75 dental chairs, additional chairs with x-ray facilities, and 24 enclosed dental suites equipped for aerosol generating procedures. Students learn to provide care across the lifespan, treating clients with various oral health needs. Interested students who need more competitive marks can enroll in the Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Advanced Diplomas and Degrees (A108) program. Travel to off-site placement sites may be required, and clinical hours include early mornings that extend into the evening.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Dental Hygiene Program S134 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The Advanced Diplomas and Degrees (A108) program at the college helps students develop skills in math, biology, chemistry, physics, and communication. Graduates are eligible to apply for the National Dental Hygiene Certification Examination, which is a requirement for registration by the College of Dental Hygienists of Ontario to practice in Ontario. A career in dental hygiene may include clinical practice, community health services, hospitals, teaching institutions, collective living centres, research, and the dental industry. Graduates who meet certain requirements are eligible to apply to George Brown's Restorative Dental Hygiene program or the new Bachelor of Science (Dental Hygiene) degree completion program. Required courses for Semester 1 include Human Anatomy and Physiology I (BIOL 1024), Microbiology and Infection Control (BIOL 1034), Dental Hygiene Principles I (DENT 1060), and Dental Hygiene Clinical Practice I (DENT 1093). Note: Courses are subject to change.

FACTUAL INFORMATION AND ENTITIES:
- Advanced Diplomas and Degrees (A108) program
- math, biology, chemistry, physics, communication

Context:
Program Offered: Dental Hygiene
Semesters: 6 (likely the total number of semesters for the program)
Courses:
- DENT 3035: Evidence-Based Practice
- DENT 3042: Clinic IV
- DENT 3043: Workplace Readiness
- DENT 3044: Health Policy
- DENT 3030: Comprehensive Case Studies in Dental Hygiene
- DENT 3031: Community Field Practicum
General Education Electives: Available, details not provided
Course Outlines and Learning Outcomes: Yes
Learning Outcomes (Graduate will be able to):
1. Practice professionally and competently within the defined scope of practice.
2. Evaluate clients' oral health status using determinants of health and risk analysis.
3. Design, implement, and evaluate a range of primary, interceptive, therapeutic, preventative, and ongoing oral health-care services.
4. Analyze oral health issues in need of advocacy and identify networks to support change.
5. Identify and select quality assurance standards and protocols.
6. Establish and maintain professional and interprofessional relationships that contribute to client care safety and positive outcomes.
7. Facilitate the development of specific oral health attitudes, knowledge, skills, and behaviors in clients.
8. Develop and present a model for a DH practice that addresses relevant business principles, current legislation, and standards of practice.
Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Students: $17,265.00 (for two semesters)
- International Students: $35,269.00 (for two semesters)
Additional Costs: Not specified in the text

Please note that additional electives need to be taken throughout the program and that classes may be scheduled Monday to Friday from 7:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. as Dental Hygiene is a full-time program.

Context: Students in the S134 program are required to meet mandatory pre-placement health requirements, including a Police Vulnerable Sector Check that must be renewed annually. The process for obtaining the check can take up to eight months. Students are responsible for paying associated fees and keeping the original copy of the check. Failure to provide a clear check may prevent students from starting field or clinical placements and completing the program. Covid-19 vaccination is highly recommended, but not required, for some placements. Students who are not vaccinated may not be able to attend external clinical or field placements, potentially affecting their ability to complete the program.

Context: The Dental Clinic at the college does not require vaccination but it is highly recommended. Use of PPE will be required in all onsite clinics.
